newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY UNION-NORTHERN TRANSVAAL RETAIN UNBEATEN HOME RECORD.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-NORTHERN TRANSVAAL RETAIN UNBEATEN HOME RECORD.

text.p: Northern Transvaal kept their unbeaten home record on Saturday with a 34-27 victory over the Waikato Chiefs in the Super 12 competition.
Northern Transvaal took a maximum five points by scoring four tries to two, after the Chiefs had controlled the game during the opening 30 minutes.

The home side fought back through tries from full-back Graham Bouwer, after an incursion from Springbok centre Andre Snyman, and flanker Nicky van der Walt who drove over from a tap penalty in first half injury time.

Northerns stretched their 17-13 half time lead with two tries from Springbok left wing Jacques Olivier in the 48th and 55th minutes. The first was the result of slick interpassing, the second an interception after a powerful tackle from Snyman had freed the ball.
In between All Black wing Glen Osborne scored Waikato's second try then Matthew Cooper slotted two penalties to narrow the gap to 31-24.

In the dying minutes Cooper and Casper Steyn exchanged penalties as the Chiefs threw everything into a last ditch effort, but the outstanding Northerns defence held firm and the visitors had to be content with a bonus point for finishing within seven points of the winners.

Northern Transvaal - Graeme Bouwer; Casper Steyn, Andre Snyman, Kosie van Vuuren (Wynand Lourens 59), Jacques Olivier; Boeta Wessels, Joost van der Westhuizen; Adriaan Richter (captain), Jannie Brooks, Nicky van der Walt, Wium Basson, Krynauw Ott (Derrick Grobelaar 44), Marius Hurter, Henry Tromp, Lourens Campher.

Waikato - Matthew Cooper; Glen Osborne, Frank Bunce (Bruce Reihana 50, Walter Little, Eric Rush; Blair Feeney, Rhys Duggan; Dion Muir (Aaron Hopa 66), Dean Anglesey, Errol Brain, Glenn Taylor, Ian Jones (captain), Richard Loe, Greg Smith, Michael Collins.
